etymologies: mid 19th century: Mexican Spanish use of Spanish cholla ‘skull, head’, of unknown origin

definitions: a cactus with a cylindrical stem, native to Mexico and the southwestern US.

notes.text: Genus Cylindropuntia, family Cactaceae: several species, including the densely spiny teddy-bear cholla (C. bigelovii) and the treelike cane cholla (C. spinosior)

shortDefinitions: cactus with cylindrical stem, native to Mexico
